newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Gold to hold support, silver may bounce.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Gold to hold support, silver may bounce.

text.p: SPOT NY CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30

Gold is expected to hold above $340.00 an ounce in European trading on Tuesday, though it will struggle to make significant gains after recent stop loss and investment fund selling, traders and chartists said.
Silver is expected to bounce, while platinum is likely to be locked in a sideways trading pattern, they added.
GOLD - Despite stop loss and investment fund selling over the past few days gold is likely to find support at $340.00 an ounce on Tuesday and could even turn to test slightly higher levels.
Karen Jones of Credit Suisse First Boston said gold should find good underlying support between $340.00 and $338.00, while she was pegging $345 as a stiff upside barrier.
"Gold is due for a bounce, though any upside gains will be limited," Jones commented.

Other market operators agreed saying that they believed that the selling that has recently rocked the market is all but over. "We have tested $340.00 which has held...some buying is creeping back in," one trader said.
On the charts resistance is likely to be found from the 10- and 30-day moving averages at around $344.92 and $343.38, analysts said.
At 0735 GMT spot gold was quoted at $342.10/342.60, versus London's Monday close of $341.00/341.50.
